Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the potential for foreign countries to print millions of mail-in ballots and influence the outcome of the election.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that millions of mail-in ballots will be printed by foreign countries.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that foreign countries have the capability and intent to print millions of fraudulent mail-in ballots.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there are numerous logistical hurdles and security safeguards in place to prevent foreign interference in the election.
Exist alternative explanation: Some experts suggest that if foreign actors were to attempt interference, their goal might be to create chaos and confusion among American voters, rather than to actually influence the outcome of the election.
